text.headline: Wells Fargo
text.text: According to Trump’s May 2016 Federal Election Commission filing, which provides a range of values for each of his stock holdings, he owns anywhere from $500,000 to $1 million worth of shares each in Citigroup, JP Morgan Chase , Wells Fargo, Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs -- in other words, five of the famous “big six” banks.

text.headline: Trump's Stock Portfolio: Big Oil, Big Banks And More Foreign Connections
text.text: Forbes / Trump's Stock Portfolio: Big Oil, Big Banks And More Foreign Connections
